Personal Storytelling for Social Change (Sept - Oct 2019)

course overview

week 1 (7 sept): listening and intro to strategic storytelling

  • Introductions + review of course
  • Group Agreements
  • Just Listen & Levels of Listening
  • What is Strategic Storytelling?
  • Logistics: Starting with the end in mind
  • Resources

    • levels of listening from otto scharmer, illustrated by kelvy bird

week 2 (14 sept): stories with social impact

  • Stories with Social Impact
  • Deep/Generative Interviewing
  • Battle of the Story vs Story of the Battle

week 3 (5 oct): digging into your story

  • Rapidfire Story Analysis
  • Peer story coaching
  • Story Arcs

week 4 (12 oct): endings and beginnings

  • Story coaching
  • “Run-of-show” for performances
  • Feedback and Evaluation
  • Endings and Beginnings

info for the live events

links coming later

boston and regional places to practice/learn storytelling

  • The Moth: Boston
  • MassMouth
  • Mass Mouth Story Slams
  • Stories to Scenes: MassMouth storytellers join performers from the Riot Improv in a night where storytelling and improv collide. Stories to Scenes sees four Massmouth tellers share their personal stories, which Riot Improv turns into an improvised scene. - For tickets and more information, visit the Riot Theater website.
  • East Meets Words (open mic)
  • Now Listen Here at the Home.stead bakery & cafe, 1448 Dorchester Ave!
  • House Slam at Haley House
  • Grubb Street (has awesome programs, workshops, and classes)
  • Stories from the Stage

storytelling resource exchange

if you have resources you want to share with the group, email me and i’ll add them here.

  • from lawrence
    • The Public Narrative: How to develop yours and a visual model of it
    • the s/hero’s journey
    • The Six Main Arcs in Storytelling, as Identified by an A.I.
    • The Neighborhood Story Project: Our Stories Told by Us
    • Center for Story-based Strategy (CSS)
    • The storytelling quotes I had up in the room as an internet slideshow, as a printable set of pages, and my personal quote tumblr
  • from others…

some books/resources i recommend related to storytelling…

  • re:imagining change
  • how your story sets you free
  • neighborhood storytelling project
  • Personal Storytelling: Discovering the Extraordinary in the Ordinary
  • The Storytelling Animal: How Stories Make Us Human
  • Tell Me Your Story: How Therapy Works to Awaken, Heal, and Set You Free
